title: One kidney, please!  - NVIDIA RTX 4090
description: Get $25 off all pairs of Vessi Footwear with offer code shortcircuit at    The 4090 is here! We can't turn it on or talk about performance at all, but we stole the Zotac 4090 Extreme Airo GPU from Labs so we can unbox it for you and talk about what we should expect from 4090 performance.  Buy a Zotac Gaming GEFORCE RTX 4090 AMP Extreme AIRO:   Purchases made through some store links may provide some compensation to Linus Media Group.  Want us to unbox something? Make a suggestion at    SUBSCRIBE ON FLOATPLANE:    GET MERCH:   AFFILIATES, SPONSORS & REFERRALS:   PODCAST GEAR:   SUPPORT US ON FLOATPLANE:   FOLLOW US ELSEWHERE ---------------------------------------------------   Twitter:  Instagram:  TikTok:  Facebook:   CHAPTERS --------------------------------------------------- 0:00 Our 4090 FE was stolen 0:53 Unboxing and basic specs 2:36 Initial design impressions 3:12 What we know about performance 3:51 Sponsor - Vessi 4:32 DLSS 3, RTX Remix, AV1 Encoding 8:31 More on design and current 3090 pricing 10:15 Outro
transcript: I had a really great plan for our unboxing video for nvidia's Flagship RTX 4090 I was gonna unbox the founders Edition but then our lab said sorry Linus we need it for benchmarking so I wasn't able to do that then I was gonna unbox one from EVGA so we'll settle for the next best thing check out this it's the RTX 4090 from Zotac that's right friends love gaming power the win here we go this GPU starts at 1600 US Dollars which means all the cool features and performance you're about to hear about can be yours five to six years from now once the price drops to a more worldly level this bad boy features over 16 000 of nvidia's Cuda cores 24 gigabytes of gddr6x memory and wow a whopping power consumption of 450 Watts which necessitates ah this is cool this new PCI Express Gen 5 12 pin power connector not only does it have 12 volt and ground pins but it also has these sense pins that allow your GPU and your power applied to communicate their capabilities with each other to ensure that your system will never run out of spec now there's been quite a bit of discussion online about the fragility of these connectors apparently bending them at a really extreme angle can cause them to heat up this is actually true of typical PCI Express power connectors as well but what I will say is that the problem is probably exacerbated by the tiny tiny pins I wonder what the motivation was for that when you consider that the graphics cards these things are going to be attached to are so big oh I feel like it's too hot for TV but I'm gonna show it to you this monster Turbo's up to 2.52 gigahertz in the founders Edition configuration and overclocked cards could end up exceeding that 2.23 gigahertz base and in spite of all that Nvidia claims that configured with a Ryzen* 5900 X CPU you shouldn't need more than an 850 watt power supply in order to power it now what's really interesting to me looking at a card this size it has a whopping three what appear to be 100 110 millimeter fans but the actual length of the PCB is only up to here which means that this solid ass hunk of aluminum fins all down the back which also has a pass-through so you can see this fan right here is just blowing straight through the cooler is all needed to cool this thing good gravy now since everything but the unboxing is still embargoed by Nvidia I'm not able to share any of our own published they didn't tell us too much about performance in traditional rasterized games but we did see anywhere from two to as much as four times the performance in games using uh RTX Ray tracing and creatures in which case you should feel pretty bad your feet will thank you for wearing these though even if the creatures you're stepping on don't so say goodbye to wet socks and save 25 with our offer code short circuit at bessie.com Short Circuit first up dlss 3.0 is looking kind of amazing the first two generations of dlss were pretty straightforward we rendered at a lower resolution then used machine learning to upscale that rendered out image to a higher resolution improving visual Fidelity while hopefully not having too many artifacts or anomalies the LSS 3.0 takes it to a whole new where you would need such a technology but that's something we're only going to be able to talk about once we can actually measure it the other big one though is that their new Ray tracing cores are supposedly up to double the performance and efficiency of their old ones which has led to some absolutely mind-bending demos okay this RC race car demo that Nvidia produced I think they had they say 30 of their artists work on it apparently uses no pre-baked lighting whatsoever so we are just looking at Material physics to create these effects that is the kind of thing that I have dreamed about in games since well since I was old enough to dream about it high school maybe whatever it looks really cool another big highlight for me has got to be RTX remix man this was a mind-blowing demo when they pulled out Morrowind and it looked like this the ability to take an older game and essentially import objects environments lighting and then edit the game and play it back with edited elements could be an absolute Game Changer now I have seen some folks actually speaking out against this type of remixing and the arguments are are pretty fair you know like you might take away the artist's intended Ambiance or you might lose things like a lighting effect that lit up that doorway so that the player would know where to go next but the flip side of that argument is this might be our only chance of preserving these types of experiences I mean single player games without you know a season's pass or any other kind of games as a service elements are going the way of the dinosaur and you
